item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 announced, launches in 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/nintendo-switch-2-announced-launches-in-2025

  • Switch 2

NIntendo Direct: Nintendo Switch 2 set for April 2.

Nintendo has officially announced Switch 2, its successor the March 2017-released Switch. It will launch in 2025.

A Switch 2-focused Nintendo Direct will be held on April 2 with further information. A series of Switch 2 hands-on experience events will also be held around the world starting in April, including:

  • North America
    • New York – April 4 to 6, 2025
    • Los Angeles – April 11 to 13, 2025
    • Dallas – April 25 to 27, 2025
    • Toronto – April 25 to 27, 2025
  • Europe
    • Paris – April 4 to 6, 2025
    • London – April 11 to 13, 2025
    • Milan – April 25 to 27, 2025
    • Berlin – April 25 to 27, 2025
    • Madrid – May 9 to 11, 2025
    • Amsterdam – May 9 to 11, 2025
  • Oceania
    • Melbourne – May 10 to 11, 2025
  • Asia
    • Tokyo (Makuhari) – April 26 to 27, 2025
    • Seoul – May 31 to June 1, 2025
    • Hong Kong – To be announced
    • Taipei – To be announced

Switch 2 will play Switch 2-exclusive games, as well as both physical and digital Switch games. Certain Switch games may not be supported or fully compatible with Switch 2. Details will be shared at a later date.

Watch the Switch 2 announcement trailer below.

Freeom Wars Remastered opens at 13,106 retail copies sold.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for the weeks of January 6, 2025 to January 12, 2025.

Freedom Wars Remastered was the highest selling new release of the week, opening at 8,277 units on Switch and 4,829 units on PlayStation 5 for an opening week total of 13,106 retail copies sold. The PlayStation 4 version is a digital-only release.

On the hardware side, the Switch family sold 57,831 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 11,828 units, the Xbox Series family sold 876 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 31 units.
